comments.comment: Anee moda ballo baappawa murunga aththe thiyala wede dhennai hadhanne ubalage genuth ekka idhapan peththakata wela ubath campus geye Namal baby niithiya kala wagedha A/L pass nethuwa kohomadha ballo campus geye

comments.comment: Beautifying cities is not development. I'm not against that. Of course, we love to see the cleanliness and beauty in the cities and villages. My point is that people must be developed first and taught to maintain it. People must be self sufficient, prices of food must be reasonable, health facilities available at low cost and comfortable transportation, government sector must not be lazy but must work, giving bribes or taking bribes must not happen, services to public should be readily and courteously given to anyone, a meaningful education, an honest and respectful society, to name a few - in brief people must be happy and healthy, comfortable, restpectful & honorable. There should be a balance to everything. If it takes 3 months to change bulb, then the faulty system is in the high places. It is the corrupt system which flows from the top to the bottom.
comments.author: Dhelene Wanigasekera

comments.comment: I seriously think that Parliament MPs, Ministers, Cabinet ministers all together should be limited to 50. Why do Sri Lankan Taxpayers take the burden to feed 225 MPs. They are given Benz Cars, Jeeps, Free petrol, Houses and after that 5-years pension. Above all, any idiot can go to Parliament even without GCE OL. The current electoral areas should be widened to minimize the number of MPs to 50. We have Town council elections, Palath Saba elections, Pradesiya Saba Elections and many more. What a nonsense. I think Late Pres. R. Premadasa brought all those nonsense.  Abolish all and appoint good educated administrators to replace wherever possible. If we have honest dedicated police force, Army, Navy, Airforce where Politicians cannot interfere like in developed countries (Australia, UK, USA Europe) then we can develop. We should have a good honest, impartial one legal system for the whole country. Not, different legal system for Muslims and Sharia law in Sri Lanka and Thesavalmei to Jaffna and UP-country Tamils another law. The time has come to launch projects to increase the Sinhalese population also inline with Muslims. No specific regions should be allowed to Muslims, Tamils. I hope you will take this message to Hon Gotabaya Rajapaksha and Other top Honest politicians. Clearly, Sajith Premadasa with RW were trying to divide the country. They might have, even erased the Buddhism from some areas in the country.  But not anymore I hope. That was why Tamils and Muslims voted to Sajith heavily. They had a secret agenda before and after the election if they won
comments.author: Singappuli Wijewardana

comments.comment: There is no true development in the country to my understanding, what your dad did was he brought a lot of loans with a high-interest rate and your uncle used them for color washing buildings. Nothing did, Chines engineers laid highways. I am not surprised by your statement and definition for development, one who passed O/L could understand the theory behind the process of country development. If you define that was a real development Sri Lanka wouldn't have such a huge debt. Sri Lanka owes more than $52 billion of dollars for foreign countries. Sri Lanka is a very poor country and still depends on foreign loans and aids, so foreign influences will be very powerful even if your uncle act as a half-dictator.
comments.author: Mark Brooks
